title: Japan's next prime minister could be the youngest candidate in a crowded election for party leadership
content: Shinjiro Koizumi surfed and ate sashimi in Fukushima to quell water safety concerns. He was also the first sitting cabinet minister to take paternity leave.
summary: Shinjiro Koizumi surfed and ate sashimi in Fukushima to quell water safety concerns. He was also the first sitting cabinet minister to take paternity leave.

title: Nvidia's earnings report shows the problem of being priced for perfection
content: Nvidia topped Wall Street estimates across the board in its earnings report on Wednesday, though its gross margin showed slight slippage.
summary: Nvidia topped Wall Street estimates across the board in its earnings report on Wednesday, though its gross margin showed slight slippage.

title: Finland will soon bury nuclear waste in a geological tomb that’s built to last for 100,000 years
content: The pioneering project has been hailed as both a watershed moment for the long-term sustainability of nuclear energy and "a model for the entire world."

title: Biden and Xi to speak after rare U.S. security adviser trip to China

title: Nokia brand owner launches Barbie phone for $130 — with no internet

title: You have a right to ignore your bosses — but only in these countries, and after work hours
content: Australia has joined the list of countries that allow employees the "right to disconnect" from work.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia beat expectations – as expected?
content: Is it fair to say Nvidia beat expectations, if retail investors always expect that the company will exceed expectations?

title: U.S. government researchers visit a Korean mine as the race against China for critical minerals heats up

content: The milestone came two days before Buffett's 94th birthday.

title: Libya’s power divisions could once more fracture its oil output – as markets question for how long

title: This high-income region has the least active people globally, WHO report shows
content: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.

title: Goldman issues warning on how quickly market confidence has recovered from an August stocks slump

title: Chinese EV company Xpeng sees shares pop 6% after it launches mass-market car

title: China’s state media: Canada is 'shooting itself in the foot’ with new EV tariffs

title: China's Nongfu Spring sees shares fall over 12% as beverage maker's profit growth slows
